thread.title: Hawaiian Airlines to fly Oakland Raiders as team's charter carrier for 2015 football season
thread.title_full: Hawaiian Airlines to fly Oakland Raiders as team's charter carrier for 2015 football season

author: Darin Moriki
title: Hawaiian Airlines to fly Oakland Raiders as team's charter carrier for 2015 football season
text:
Enlarge Blanca Torres/SFBT The start of a game at Oakland Coliseum, the home field of the Oakland Raiders is seen in… more With only one day left until the official start of this year's National Football League season, the Oakland Raiders renewed its partnership with Hawaiian Airlines as the team's official charter after a brief, yearlong hiatus, the Honolulu-based airline said Wednesday. “Hawaiian pairs a winning combination of unmatched comfort with excellent service and they are dedicated to helping the players and coaches get ready for football,” Oakland Raiders President Marc Badain said in statement on Wednesday. Starting with the Raiders’ Thursday preseason game against the Seattle Seahawks, Hawaiian Airlines' designated Airbus A330 aircraft, featuring the Raiders’ logo, will carry the team's players, coaches and trainers to eight games through December, including those in Seattle, Cleveland, Chicago, San Diego, Pittsburgh, Detroit, Nashville, and Denver. Hawaiian Airlines, a subsidiary of Hawaiian Holdings Inc. (Nasdaq: HA), has operated flights out of Oakland International Airport since 2008 and flies daily nonstop flights to both Honolulu and Kahului on Maui. During the peak summer months, between May and September, Hawaiian Airlines also operates seasonal nonstop routes from Oakland to Lihue on Kauai and Kona on the Big Island.
